info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 3:07PM PDT until July 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. * WHEN...Until 515 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM PDT, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Reports of water on the roadway causing traffic issues at Decatur Blvd and Silverado Ranch Blvd. Area webcams show minor ponding and wet roads around southwest Las Vegas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountains Edge, Enterprise, Spring Valley, Southern Highlands, Blue Diamond, The Strip, Summerlin, Paradise, Sloan and Mccarran International Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
